decks.notes: This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Nihil Spellbomb while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf. The deck also includes versatile cards like Consign to Memory and Molten Collapse to control the board and finish off opponents. With a mix of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Force of Will for protection, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in a fast-paced Legacy format.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary combo pieces to mill your own library, while also generating mana through cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide. Once you have milled yourself enough, you can use cards like Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return to win the game. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Pact of Negation and Cabal Therapy to protect your combo. Overall, the goal is to combo off quickly and win the game before your opponent can stop you.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying constant pressure with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Murktide Regent. The deck aims to control the game tempo using disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, while also utilizing efficient removal spells such as Fatal Push. The deck also includes card draw and filtering options like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency. The land base is optimized for fetching and mana fixing, allowing the deck to operate smoothly and effectively in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize cards like Mystic Forge, Grim Monolith, and Manifold Key to generate infinite mana, allowing for continuous plays and combos. The deck focuses on tutoring for key pieces with Urza's Saga and using artifacts like Glaring Fleshraker and Planar Nexus to control the board. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and disruption while Urza's Tower and Ancient Tomb help to ramp up mana production. Overall, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and overwhelm the opponent with powerful combos.

The deck utilizes the Show and Tell combo to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Archon of Cruelty early in the game, overwhelming opponents. It includes cards like Sneak Attack and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to further support this strategy, along with counter spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce for protection. The deck also includes a variety of lands and card draw spells to ensure consistency in executing the combo. Overall, the key concept revolves around quickly and efficiently getting big creatures into play to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Gaea's Cradle and mana dorks to ramp up quickly and efficiently, with the goal of generating a large amount of mana to cast powerful green creatures and spells. It also incorporates cards like Endurance and Misty Rainforest for graveyard interaction and deck thinning, as well as control elements like Sylvan Safekeeper and Collector Ouphe to disrupt opponents. The inclusion of cards like Natural Order and Craterhoof Behemoth allows for explosive finishes, making it a versatile and adaptable control deck in Legacy format.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Broadside Bombardiers and Laelia, the Blade Reforged, along with powerful spells like Blood Moon and Sundering Eruption to quickly disrupt the opponent's game plan and close out the game before they can stabilize. The deck takes advantage of mana acceleration from cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to power out its threats early and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Magus of the Moon and The One Ring further disrupts the opponent's ability to cast spells and allows the deck to push through for victory.
